<p>
Below the reader can find the geographical locations of oil and gas extraction by companies in the collateral assets scheme. Oil and gas production is located primarily outside of the EU, the US having the largest share of production for both fossil fuels. Notable other countries for Oil production include (ranked by oil production at sites in this country): Iraq, Angola, Norway, UAE, Brazil and Nigeria. For Gas production (ranked by gas production at sites in this country): Egypt, Norway, Australia, Trinidad & Tobago, Qatar, Nigeria. As highlighted by different authors including [here](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/national-institute-economic-review/article/abs/stranded-assets-and-sovereign-states/5379F112676DF91F18349E5C7B8AB624) the location of a lot of oil and gas assets in sovereign countries highly dependent on those, might mean that a substantial part of these assets could become stranded. This means that it is not only important to consider the transition risk of the companies in the collateral framework that can directly contribute to price instability, but also the transition risk faced by highly fossil fuel dependent economies which can cause knock-on effects for further causes of risk.
